m_szDocSumamry: BBC News US to build $120m rare earth research institute By Katia Moskvitch Technology reporter, BBC News 11 January 2013 From the section Technology Image caption The US was once the world's leader in rare earth production The US Department of Energy is giving $120m (Â£75m) to set up a new research centre charged with developing new methods of rare earth production. Rare earths are 17 chemically similar elements crucial to making many hi-tech products, such as phones and PCs. The Critical Materials Institute will be located in Ames, Iowa.
